bibl.title: Twenty-two Historical Encyclopedias Encoded in TEI: a New Resource for the Digital Humanities
bibl.author: Hagen, Thora
Ketzan, Erik
Jannidis, Fotis
Witt, Andreas

abstract.ab: This example is used to demonstrate browsing a compound resource consisting of many, small entries: rather than showing the entire encyclopedia by division or page, we want to search for and present single headwords. The main pb-view uses a mapping function to select the entry corresponding to the headword. A client-side url template defines how the headword is encoded in the URL, which has the structure /encyclopedia/{headword}. A corresponding server-side endpoint is defined as well, so we get dynamic, but still bookmarkable URLs.
